elements.title: William Savage (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American ornithologist William Savage painted pictures of birds (example pictured) that he hunted or received?

elements.title: The Eight Great Events in the Life of Buddha (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that about 1,000 years after it was made, a stele of The Eight Great Events in the Life of Buddha is worshiped as an image of a female Hindu goddess?

elements.title: David J. Brewer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to Theodore Roosevelt, U.S. Supreme Court justice David J. Brewer had "a sweetbread for a brain" and was a "menace to the welfare of the Nation"?

elements.title: El Financiero (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the administration of Carlos Salinas de Gortari barred El Financiero from the Mexican presidential press plane for its reporting on foreign debt negotiations?

elements.title: Thomas Dickson Archibald (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Thomas Dickson Archibald, when speaking against increasing fines for violating liquor licenses, said "we need only go a step further and make the violation a hanging matter"?

elements.title: M8 Armored Gun System (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that eight years after the U.S. Army canceled the M8 Armored Gun System, the 82nd Airborne Division requested that prototypes from the program be sent to Iraq?

elements.title: a Triassic marine reptile (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that skeletons of a Triassic marine reptile were discovered at an altitude of about 2,700 metres (8,900 ft) above sea level?

elements.title: for two trumpets (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the only trumpet concerto by Antonio Vivaldi is for two trumpets?
